item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:13, topic:342743”]I would avoid those form generators. Most cough up bad code and you don’t get much control over it.
Try writing a GUI from scratch; you’ll learn a lot more and you can tailor your code to your needs.[/quote]
netbeans does a pretty good job.

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No offense, but there is no way anyone would use a program like this. They are typing in all of the names anyway, so it saves no time.

But for some real CC on your code:

[ul][li]For your Strings, you don’t need to do: “” + _____.getText(); because the getText() method already returns a String. You only use “”+ when you are adding other objects to strings, because it calls the objects toString() method. (Someone correct me if I am wrong on that)[/li][li]For your ‘if(buttonUsed)’ and statements, use a switch statement instead:
[/li][/ul]

switch(buttonUsed) { case 1: generateAccess = "public"; break; case 2: generateAccess = "private"; break; case 3: generateAccess = "protected"; break; }

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:342743”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=439146.msg3227286#msg3227286 date=1275702277]
Just because I used a generator doesn’t mean I don’t know what the methods are for JPanel/JFrame
[/quote]Very true. But the whole point of posting something no one will actually use is for learning and to get some constructive criticism on your code. And using a program that generates the code for you is not only not the best way to learn, but we won’t be CC’ing your work, we will be CC’ing the programs code.[/quote]

I want CC on the program. What people want from it. How to make it better.

[code=java] private int buttonUsed = 1;
private void generateCodeButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
String generateAccess = “”;
String generatedCode = “void " +methodEntryField.getText()+ " {”;
String generateInt = “”+intEntryField.getText();
String generateInt2 = “”+intEntryField2.getText();
String generateBoolean = “”+booleanEntryField.getText();
String generateBoolean2 = “”+booleanEntryField2.getText();
String generateString = “”+stringEntryField.getText();
String generateString2 = “”+stringEntryField2.getText();
String generateConditionOne = “”+conditionOneEntryField.getText();
String generateConditionTwo = “”+conditionTwoEntryField.getText();
String generateComment = “”;
String generateIndent = " "+generateComment;
String generateEndingBrace = “}”;
if(buttonUsed == 1) {
generateAccess = “public”;
} else if (buttonUsed == 2) {
generateAccess = “private”;
} else if (buttonUsed == 3) {
generateAccess = “protected”;

    }
    if(generateInt.isEmpty()) {
        generateInt = "null";
        generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
    }
    if(generateInt2.isEmpty()) {
        generateInt2 = "null2";
        generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
    }
    if(generateBoolean.isEmpty()) {
        generateBoolean = "null";
        generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
    }
    if(generateBoolean2.isEmpty()) {
        generateBoolean2 = "null2";
        generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
    }
    generatedText.setText(""+generateAccess+ " " +generatedCode+ "\n    int " +generateInt+ " = 0; " +generateComment+
            "\n int "+generateInt2+ " = 0; " +generateComment+ "\n   boolean " +generateBoolean+
            " = false; " +generateComment+ "\n  boolean " +generateBoolean2+ " = false; " +generateComment+


            "\n"+generateEndingBrace);

}[/code]

Above is what I’ve done myself. Basically making it work.

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:7, topic:342743”]Just because I used a generator doesn’t mean I don’t know what the methods are for JPanel/JFrame[/quote]Very true. But the whole point of posting something no one will actually use is for learning and to get some constructive criticism on your code. And using a program that generates the code for you is not only not the best way to learn, but we won’t be CC’ing your work, we will be CC’ing the programs code.

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:342743”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=439146.msg3227284#msg3227284 date=1275702029]

Also, just wondering, what is this:

    /** This method is called from within the constructor to
     * initialize the form.
     * WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is
     * always regenerated by the Form Editor.
     */
    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
    // <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc="Generated Code">
    private void initComponents() {

       etc

You used a form generator?

Basically. It locks code if you use it in an IDE. Any normal text editor, however, can edit it.
[/quote]My point is that over 3/4 of the code there is generated, and that you didn’t make that part of it.[/quote]

Just because I used a generator doesn’t mean I don’t know what the methods are for JPanel/JFrame

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA Generator [Unoriginal]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:5, topic:342743”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=439146.msg3227283#msg3227283 date=1275701685]
Also, just wondering, what is this:

    /** This method is called from within the constructor to
     * initialize the form.
     * WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is
     * always regenerated by the Form Editor.
     */
    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
    // <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc="Generated Code">
    private void initComponents() {

       etc

You used a form generator?
[/quote]

Basically. It locks code if you use it in an IDE. Any normal text editor, however, can edit it.[/quote]My point is that over 3/4 of the code there is generated, and that you didn’t make that part of it.

Read full topic

You used a form generator?[/quote]

The comment just generates a description.

    private void intEntryField2ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    // TODO add your handling code here:
    }

    private int buttonUsed = 1;
    private void generateCodeButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    String generateAccess = “”;
    String generatedCode = “void " +methodEntryField.getText()+ " {”;
    String generateInt = “”+intEntryField.getText();
    String generateInt2 = “”+intEntryField2.getText();
    String generateBoolean = “”+booleanEntryField.getText();
    String generateBoolean2 = “”+booleanEntryField2.getText();
    String generateString = “”+stringEntryField.getText();
    String generateString2 = “”+stringEntryField2.getText();
    String generateConditionOne = “”+conditionOneEntryField.getText();
    String generateConditionTwo = “”+conditionTwoEntryField.getText();
    String generateComment = “”;
    String generateIndent = " "+generateComment;
    String generateEndingBrace = “}”;
    if(buttonUsed == 1) {
    generateAccess = “public”;
    } else if (buttonUsed == 2) {
    generateAccess = “private”;
    } else if (buttonUsed == 3) {
    generateAccess = “protected”;

     }
 if(generateInt.isEmpty()) {
     generateInt = "null";
     generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
 }
 if(generateInt2.isEmpty()) {
     generateInt2 = "null2";
     generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
 }
 if(generateBoolean.isEmpty()) {
     generateBoolean = "null";
     generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
 }
 if(generateBoolean2.isEmpty()) {
     generateBoolean2 = "null2";
     generateComment = "//Unused, delete";
 }
 generatedText.setText(""+generateAccess+ " " +generatedCode+ "\n    int " +generateInt+ " = 0; " +generateComment+
         "\n int "+generateInt2+ " = 0; " +generateComment+ "\n   boolean " +generateBoolean+
         " = false; " +generateComment+ "\n  boolean " +generateBoolean2+ " = false; " +generateComment+


         "\n"+generateEndingBrace);

    }

    private void publicButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    buttonUsed = 1;
    publicButton.setActionCommand(publicButton.getText());
    publicButton.setSelected(true);
    privateButton.setSelected(false);
    protectedButton.setSelected(false);
    }

    private void privateButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    buttonUsed = 2;
    privateButton.setActionCommand(privateButton.getText());
    privateButton.setSelected(true);
    protectedButton.setSelected(false);
    publicButton.setSelected(false);
    }

    private void protectedButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    buttonUsed = 3;
    protectedButton.setActionCommand(protectedButton.getText());
    protectedButton.setSelected(true);
    privateButton.setSelected(false);
    publicButton.setSelected(false);
    }

    /**

    • @param args the command line arguments
      */
      public static void main(String args[]) {

      new GeneratorGUI().setVisible(true);
      }
      });
      }
